New Records: Ryan Helsley tied the St. Louis Cardinals' saves record with his 48th save of the season
Key Match Events: Helsley snagged the one-hopper and threw to shortstop Masyn Winn to start the double play that capped his 48th save of the season
Pre-Game Insights: Matthew Liberatore opened the ninth and was in possession of a four-run lead, but Helsley was called in to close the game
Post-Match Reflections: Helsley said he would give it all up for the Cardinals to be playoff-bound instead of already eliminated from postseason contention
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals clinched at least a.500 season on Wednesday with their 81st victory
Others: Ryan Helsley has set career highs in appearances (64) innings pitched (65 1/3) and saves (48) this season
